intro: Hieracium cernagorae subsp. vardense, commonly known as the Vardenskaya hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. The subspecies is native to specific regions in the Balkans, particularly in Albania and Kosovo. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and forest edges. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
